intro: Rapanea paniensis, commonly known as the Paniënsis lily, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red and orange. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a smooth, glossy surface. Rapanea paniensis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and mountainous areas.
